title: How to View Who Follows You on Facebook: Mobile & Desktop

steps.title: Tap your profile picture icon at the top-left corner of the Facebook app.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture icon at the top-left corner of the Facebook app . You'll see this directly under the Facebook logo in the mobile app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.

steps.title: Tap See your About info.
steps.content: Tap See your About info . This is under the Details heading.

steps.title: Scroll to the bottom of the page.
steps.content: Scroll to the bottom of the page. Your followers will be listed at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap See all to load the full list of your followers.
steps.content: Tap See all to load the full list of your followers. If you don't have many followers, you may not have an option to click the See all button.

steps.title: Look at the top-right corner of the page.
steps.content: Look at the top-right corner of the page. The number of followers you have will be listed. If you don't have any followers, you won't be able to see how many followers you have and the Followers option won't be present.

steps.title: Go to your own Profile page on Facebook.
steps.content: Go to your own Profile page on Facebook. Click your name and profile picture at the top of the left navigation panel in the upper-left corner of your browser window. It will take you to your Profile. [1] X Research source If you aren't automatically signed into Facebook, enter your email or phone and your password to log in . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Friends tab.
steps.content: Click the Friends tab. Your followers have now been moved to the same area where you can see your friends.

steps.title: Click Followers.
steps.content: Click Followers . All of your Facebook followers will be displayed here. If you don't have any followers, you won't be able to see how many followers you have and the Followers option won't be present.

steps.title: Why can't I see my followers on Facebook?
steps.content: Why can't I see my followers on Facebook? If you can't see your Facebook followers in the locations provided in the methods above, this likely means you don't have any Facebook followers.

steps.title: How do I enable followers on Facebook?
steps.content: How do I enable followers on Facebook? By default, Facebook allows your friends to follow you. To let members of the public who aren't your friends follow you, do the following: Open your Facebook settings. On desktop, click your profile picture in the top-right corner and click Settings & privacy > Settings . On mobile, tap the three-line menu button and choose Settings & privacy > Settings . Choose the Followers and public content setting. You will have to scroll to find this option. Change Who can follow me to Public . [3] X Research source

steps.title: How do I remove a Facebook follower?
steps.content: How do I remove a Facebook follower? The most effective way to remove a Facebook follower is to block them. Navigate to their profile and click/tap the three dot icon, then click/tap Block . The block option has an icon of a person with a "no" sign.
